title: (x) SwissLife logo - ITC Legacy Serif {Satya}
content:
This nice logo by Meta Design...  
Can anyone ID the font?

Thanks

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [swisslife.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201111713/http:/typophile.com/files/swisslife.jpg) | 11.39 KB |

 [‹ (x) Jif peanut butter logo - hand drawn {Florian}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201111713/http:/typophile.com/node/37492 "Go to previous forum topic") ["Rock" squooshed serif caps ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201111713/http:/typophile.com/node/37557 "Go to next forum topic")
author: belleisle

comments.content: This obviously is Jenson, but I’m having trouble finding the exact digitised version.

The closest I can think of is [Aurelia](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201111713/http:/www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=Aurelia).  
I’d guess that Meta Design wouldn’t use a standart typeface for a logotype. It’s most probably custom.

Thanks for your time people,

What a great place this is.
Jan - we’ve initiated some changes so you won’t miss links like Akira’s. It will go live soon!
Stephen. I like linking to MyFonts. The site is faster and it displays fonts better and at recognizable sizes (compared to fontshop).

That’s perfectly understandable to have preferences. Link to where you see fit. But please keep in mind that once a font has been identified and linked it’s not necessary to link again.

Can you explain what you mean by recognizable sizes? Are you referring to the samples at fontshop.de or fontshop.com? The new upgrade I mentioned will let German visitors set fontshop.com without being redirected.

I didn’t mean to link to a “better” site. I don’t care where people link to. I just didn’t see that Akira’s post had a link already. That’s all.

\> Are you referring to the samples at fontshop.de or fontshop.com?

Yes.

\> The new upgrade I mentioned will let German visitors set fontshop.com  
\> without being redirected.

Yeah, I got that. It’s about time ;-)

\>\> Are you referring to the samples at fontshop.de or fontshop.com?

\> Yes.

Hehe. These are two different sites. Are you saying that the font sizes are “unrecognizable” at both sites? I’m having trouble understanding what you mean. Fonts at fontshop.com are displayed at 36 pt. by default and can be resized all the way up to 388pts.

Oh, hehe. I thought the question was _if_ it was the samples.  
Of course, Stephen, I’m refering to fontshop.de, BECAUSE I GET REDIRECTED EVERY TIME I TRY TO GO TO FONTSHOP.COM.
THUS I AM PLEASED TO ANNOUNCE THE REDIRECTION REMOVAL IS IMMINENT.
